website_summaries.verdict: Intended for use with a standard mattress and box spring, this rail folds down so you can step out of bed or change the sheets without removing.
pros: Bed rail swings down easily for exiting the bed or changing sheets
Intended for use with a mattress and box spring, but can also work with a flat-top steel bed frame
Fits up to a queen mattress
Intended for queen bed or smaller
cons: May not be tall enough for taller mattresses, so be sure to measure carefully

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first night!
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first night we used it for my granddaughter. Woke up in the morning, and the plastic "grommet had broken and was on the floor. This is the exact same broken piece others have complained about. We have another one, similar but not same brand, that we've been using for our grandson for several years. Stay away from the Regalo brand.
customer_reviews.author: Likes To Shop

customer_reviews.title: Works well for elderly person with dementia who fidgets all night long!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what we needed for my elderly mother-in-law. She has dementia and fidgets all night long! Her husband (age 87) can now rest a little easier knowing she won't be toppling out or having her legs hang out all night. Only issue is it hits the ground when we fold it down, so we have to be careful getting her out of bed and not stepping on it. Otherwise, a great product, just what we needed. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Sciakath

customer_reviews.title: Great for cosleeping in my King
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this I read the reviews and saw mixed opinions as to whether or not it would fit a king but I decided to take the risk. My king size bed has two smaller box springs. The ties for the rail definitely do not reach across both box springs so I made it work. I just reached it across one and flipped the anchor so the long part was facing down. We use this to cosleep with my almost 5 month old. She's just started rolling over so this is great to keep her from falling off the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Krystina Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Really durable
customer_reviews.text: Makes my son feel safe in his adjustment to his new bed
customer_reviews.author: Patrick MontoyaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Box spring NOT required - fits fine on a flat top steel bed frame
customer_reviews.text: I was a little discouraged by all the reviews stating that a box spring is REQUIRED for these bedrails but after looking at the pictures closely I decided to order two anyway. We just got our 3 year old a twin size bed and mattress and two of bedrails fit perfectly fine on a flat top steel bed frame. Take a look at the customer pictures, I posted two photos.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Strong and safe
customer_reviews.text: Love this bed rail for cosleeping. My daughter fell off our high bed one night and I knew it was time to get safer. She is now 18 months old and can shake the bar and lean on it and I am never worried it will not hold her!
customer_reviews.author: B. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Very bad quality, the mesh breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Very bad quality, the mesh breaks easily. Thank you for the information and pictures. With this being from 2015, it would not be covered under warranty. Although, we do have replacement mesh covers available. To order (3) #23069, your total will be $26.00 which includes your shipping within the continental U.S. If you would like to place an order, please provide your address, phone number, and credit card billing information including the name on the card, card number, exp. date and the 3-digit code on the back of the card. We accept Visa and MasterCard. Please call the number below if you would like to provide this information over the phone, Mon-Thurs 8-5 CST, Fri 8-2:30 CST.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Dana

customer_reviews.title: Sucks with deep mattress
customer_reviews.text: On a normal, deep mattress it only sticks up a few inches. The pictures are super misleading. Measure your mattress height first.
customer_reviews.author: Citygrl00

customer_reviews.title: It's nicely made and very breathable mesh
customer_reviews.text: So, this will keep someone from falling off the bed but if you have a thick/tall mattress then it slowly slips off over time. We have a different one on a different mattress that never slips, so this seems to be a size/brand thing. It's nicely made and very breathable mesh, I would just caution the issue of using it on a really tall mattress. But I will say that even though it slowly slips (over days) it still is firm enough to catch someone from falling off the bed. It has gaps at the head and foot of the bed, obviously, if used on a king size.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Great product, pain to use with weekly (or more often) sheet changes.
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to get setup correctly but works perfectly for my energetic toddler. CONS: The straps that go under the mattress must be fixed whenever you change the sheets- its a huge pain to re-do every sheet change. The plastic and mesh material feels cheap that it could easily break/rip although it hasn't been damaged thus far. PROS: Easy to use, sturdy (toddler likes to push against it), long enough to cover substantial amount of bed, easy to put together (instructions are simple).
customer_reviews.author: JennKTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Broken in two places after a month.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for maybe a month? It's broken in 2 places and being held together with duct tape. The main bottom pole that holds the whole thing together? That little button that allows the poles to click together broke and so I had to tape it together to prevent it from just falling apart. Then this morning while folding it down the pole that actually fits into the mechanism to allow it to fokd up and down... Snapped! It broke off at the point where it's welding and now that's taped together. This is unbelievable. This is suppose to keep my child secure in bed and it's not even staying together.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Garber

customer_reviews.title: Miserable For An Adult
customer_reviews.text: It was easy enough to install but just about killed me getting in it. We have a tall bed and I have 2 fractures in my back so we bought this to keep me secure. I had to crawl in from the bottom, which was terribly painful. We took it off that night and used some tall stools as substitutes. The next day we ordered a different rail which I don't have to climb around and keeps me secure. You seriously need to redesign this, I guess it would be good for toddlers that need help getting in and out of bed, but not for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Ramey Hill

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you're going to cosleep
customer_reviews.text: Man, why didn't I buy this sooner?! My baby was sick a lot at the beginning of the year so he'd end up in my bed a lot to nurse most of the night. My bed is really, really high and so he always stayed in the middle of the bed to make sure he didn't fall off...problem is that made that side very raw from nursing all night long. We bought this so I could put him on the other side of me and it works awesome. It was easy to install and use. I'd absolutely buy this again. I have a queen bed and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Charity T.

customer_reviews.title: works with cribs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 year old, who needed one side of the rail of the crib taken down. we added this to his crib (which doesn't have a spring box), and it stays on sturdy. I love the length of it, because other Swing down rails are a lot shorter, risking the child head or limb hangs out. But with this bed rail, it pretty much covered the whole side of this crib. Although the material, seems at bit flimsy, i appreciate that it's breathable material. The price for this was great too! - Especially compared to other brands. My only suggestion, would be, more color variety. But otherwise, I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Manuela Flores

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed rail and easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: It’s really easy to install and assemble and it fits perfectly my IKEA queen bed! It looks very sturdy although the plastic pieces don’t look too strong to me and they probably won’t last that much! My only concern is that it looks like the item was returned for someone else because of the way it was packed and some marks on the plastic pieces. It’s a little bit disappointing because I paid for a new item but other than that it is very nice! Lets see if it does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Flower25

customer_reviews.title: Huge
customer_reviews.text: There is absolutely nothing wrong with this product. It was easy to assemble and install but I was just thrown off by how huge this thing is. I guess I just dont remember them being this big. My daughter upgraded to a twin and we ended up just taking it right off because she hated that it was so long it blocked most of the side of her bed. We could honestly do with about half this size, and hight but I that's our fault. We didn't measure. We just dont remember them being this large. Not for us but the product itself is great.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Can't really fold down.
customer_reviews.text: It came quickly, nicely packaged, pretty easy to assemble. breathable fabric around the edge and mesh for the interior. Sturdy enough with a toddler pushing and pulling on it. Because of these reasons, I would recommend this product. Although one of the features is that it should fold down easily, it doesn't. This feature is more hassle than anything else. The design to have it rotate is the issue. One piece doesn't stay in place or dislodges when I try to fold it down and then I wind up fighting/struggling to get it back in place for the next few minutes. It's a good product, just don't buy it if you really want it for the fold down option.
customer_reviews.author: S&H

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Safe, Works without box spring
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my 7 year old daughter’s twin loft bed because she needs a “taller” bed rail. It was easy to assemble and feels very durable. It DOESN’T require a box spring like some reviewers said. We’re using this bed rail on a twin 8” memory foam mattress without a box spring. (See photos) It holds up great even if the bed weren’t to have a rail of its own. There is a strap you can adjust to tighten or loosen the fit. I’m so glad we bought this. It gives us the extra piece of mind that my daughter won’t roll off the bed. Definitely a 5 star!
customer_reviews.author: Kailey

customer_reviews.title: Anxiety level reduced
customer_reviews.text: 2020... Anxiety inducing year. We just moved to a new location, I'm still awake. I getting ready for bed and I hear a loud thud, bang, onomatopoeia. I know where it came from... my daughter's room. I run to find her on the floor crying. Of course, I'm glad there isn't an intruder in this new area I'm unfamiliar with, but saddened as she hit her head. Amazon to the rescue. This guard/rail was very easy to assemble, and mostly easy to install. It's definitely secure as I may or may not have taken a couple naps on this bed after reading to her... Let's just say the guard can hold more weight than my daughter...
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: My worst purchase in 10 years of Amazon shopping
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived with marks all over it, like I'm not the first customer squeezing the misfitting parts together. Everything is off the mark so the depicted 'easy' slide open/close features should actually come with WD-40. As the guy at the party in charge of assembling the grill I was surprised I needed to spend so much time on what is billed as a tool free setup. On completion I find that it only fits certain bed models and I just wasted my time, a horrendous feeling. Oh, 'read the installation and disclaimer section before you order it'. I've seen pillows come with better communication.
customer_reviews.author: MCR

customer_reviews.title: Work really well
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like that it came dirty and dusty. Not the box, but the parts. There was some orange looking dust around the mesh and the while parts. But whatever, I needed it as my baby had fallen off the bed the previous night and I was terrified of another night without this kind of protection in her bed. My girl is a mover so she literally summer salts in the bed so I needed something sturdy to keep her from the edge. Night three and I can’t complain! Works great once installed. I got my sleep back too!
customer_reviews.author: Rochelly Araniz

customer_reviews.title: Not for toddler beds
customer_reviews.text: Reading reviews, it said this works with toddler beds. It doesn't. It works with a twin mattress and box spring, which is not what we needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jahosh

customer_reviews.title: Seam rips easily
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. Three months in we are past the warranty and cannot return or replace the product. The seam on the cover completely ripped without much use and not due to child error. Unable to find a replacement cover. The only reason this gets two stars is because the swing down feature makes changing sheets very easy. Greatly disappointed! Very unhappy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Silva

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but measure your mattress first!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and easy to install. We used this at the grandparents house for overnights so we had to put it up and take it down each time. Just be aware that if you have a very thick mattress they will not come up as high. Measure before you purchase and see if that would be tall enough for what you want. My daughter was a bit older when we started using them so it wasn't too much of a concern but if she had just been transitioning to a "big girl bed" I woudn't have purchased them for a very thick mattress.
customer_reviews.author: JKM4410

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to put together, and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today for my one year old daughter's toddler bed. It uses a crib mattress to give you an idea of size. There is no box frame, just slats. I got it to keep her from climbing out. She is taking her first nap in her bed right now. I used the straps and wrapped them around the frame. Once I put the mattress in, it was extremely sturdy!! So far it is working great.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: OK but not as sturdy as older version we had for our toddlers
customer_reviews.text: One quality flaw. No lock spring button at one connection point. Debated return husband put it together with pop rivet Glad he thought of that but of course take apart not easy now. Few design shortfalls. No mention of what size bed the flimsy straps fit and typ of mattress since a foam mattress doesn’t have a firm side to pull on. Design just squishes mattress. Top leans outwards which makes one wonder about security. Our old ones in 1973 had L shaped rods that extended under 2/3 of twin mattress and were very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: L. White

customer_reviews.title: Changed Product
customer_reviews.text: +5: Bought this last year - purchased two, one for each side of the bed. Worked well, came with instructions for lining up the anchors on each side, both items matched. Pretty sturdy if installed correctly and swing-down rail is very convenient, though it takes a bit of room to use. -2: Bought two more this year for grandma's house - different products from the original two and different design from each other. Now the instructions say NOT to use two, it's a safety issue, and instead to purchase a separate double-sided one. Frustrating to purchase four in less than a year and receive three different designs.
customer_reviews.author: Farlin

customer_reviews.title: Over-Engineered Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: This product is difficult to assemble, seriously over-engineered and potentially hazardous by its own manual's warnings. The frame cover is listed as a potential suffocation hazard, the straps are listed as a potential choking hazard. I purchased this for a toddler grandchild and sadly, installed it after the return window. It simply did not work for me as the rail portion would not tighten to the mattress, creating yet another potential risk, where a toddler could roll in-between the mattress and frame rail. I would give this a zero rating if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Iron Mike

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get into proper place.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the product is great, and the assembly was simple enough. My issue is with how this attaches to the bed frame. It is very difficult to secure the rail to the box spring and put the mattress on top. It would be impossible to do alone. Also, and maybe this is an issue with the bed I have it attached to but, without a high enough box spring, this rail won't swing down and must stay in the up position. I would buy again, but I would prefer if instead of a pulley system, the under mattress part were full length rods.
customer_reviews.author: EDB

customer_reviews.title: Great rails for kids and dogs!🐕
customer_reviews.text: I have a queen size bed and this worked great . The only thing is getting the nylon straps to other side you need to take mattress off but this makes it very secure for a small child. I bought this to keep my Pomeranian from rolling off the bed. Pet people this works perfectly for me. The other great thing is it has easy latches to just fold down don't have to remove to change sheets once installed you are done. A fantastic product worth price. Highly recommend!🐕♥️
customer_reviews.author: cATHY cARPENTER

customer_reviews.title: best value, does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Got this after a scary night of my 4 year old falling out of his bed in his sleep. So far we have had no issues and I feel much better knowing that my son is safe. He feels secure in the bed and there is plenty of room for him to climb into bed around the rail but it also pops down easily if I need to get in and out of his bed and don't want to climb around. It's long enough that he definitely will not fall out of bed again. highly recommend this product for kids that move around a lot in their sleep!
customer_reviews.author: KBT

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my 3-yr old in her new full size bed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bed rail for my 3-yr old daughter's new full-size bed to help her transition from sleeping in a crib. I positioned it in the middle of the bed so there is a little space for her to climb in/out of bed at either the headboard or the footboard. The bed rail is sturdy and has kept her from falling out of her bed. I am using this rail on a full-size bed that has a mattress and box springs on a metal bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: Glow81

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough to travel with
customer_reviews.text: This product was used three times thus far on a twin, full, and even did fit (barely) on a king sized bed. Easy enough to travel with, as long as you have some kind of game plan with what you're going to do with the straps that are actually quite long and sometimes cumbersome if traveling down flights of stairs or trying to balance on a luggage cart. We would purchase again knowing what we know now about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Flesher

customer_reviews.title: DId not work so well for our 90-lb disabled son.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our disabled son who has tended to wiggle out of his bed. Overall, I am pretty pleased but twice he has pushed on it so hard the straps securing it under the mattress slipped and he fell to the floor. Had the straps been placed higher they could have choked him overnight.I would not buy this again for an older patient. I think the design could be vastly improved to prevent such accidents if the straps went all the way around the mattress and secured with a cinch closure.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bush

customer_reviews.title: Misleading videos but good quality bed rail
customer_reviews.text: I actually like this bed rail; however, I got very disappointed when I received the rail and realized that the second video posted for this item is misleading. The bed rail that I got doesn’t slide in, it just swing down. I think the second video should be removed from this item post. The actual bed rail is good quality and I’m keeping it. It’s also in the larger side so for a toddler bed doesn’t leave too much space for the child to get down the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Joegalle

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was simpler & cheaper, but best option out there.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special here. Works as needed. I wish it didn't have the swing down function, which we will never ever use. Our child climbs into bed from the foot of the bed. We do not mess with the rail. If this was simpler it could also be cheaper. Should be $7. Why overcomplicate things? But alas, there is nothing simpler on the market. So this is what we had to get. Works for our purposes, but more "features" than we need.
customer_reviews.author: MookieL

customer_reviews.title: Good but not for me
customer_reviews.text: Too big for a converted crib, it takes up the whole side so kid can't get in and out, may as well just leave the crib side on at that point. Would work a lot better with an actual bed and a bed that's high enough off the ground that it can swing down better.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and doesn't work with memory foam mattress
customer_reviews.text: It did NOT work for our twin bed setup. The memory foam mattress does not use a box spring - it has the wooden slats. I suspect this only works on box spring setups. Even if it did work with out kid's setup, I wouldn't trust it. This thing is really cheaply made and flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Harder than it looks to install
customer_reviews.text: I remain unconfident that I have installed this thing correctly. It’s way harder to maneuver that strap than you’d think it would be. Still, it gives my kid a feeling of security, and it’s enough of a barrier to wake him if he was really up against it. Like would I rely on this product to put him up on a 3 decker bunk bed and trust it to catch his fall? No. But his regular twin bed? Yeah. It’s better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Shannan

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for bunk bed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this purely for my peace of mind, for the bunk bed. It was delivered a day early (expecting it by Sat, but got it on Friday), so that's always extra nice. There's only a slight issue with installation, the tubes seem to be a bit tight, or I'd have lubed them before plugging them in, but a 5 min fussing around, is really not the biggest deal... just love it in my bunk bed now.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Crib
customer_reviews.text: Got this when my son was climbing out of the crib, and converted to toddler bed. It was so long there was only a little room, maybe 4 inches for him to walk/crawl around it to get in. But it has held up to him climbing over it with no issues
customer_reviews.author: Michelle O.

customer_reviews.title: Good product priced right.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. I failed to see it fits only a queen sized bed. I needed it to block my dachshunds from jumping off the bed, and using their ramp. The straps and legs secured it enough for my purpose on my king sized bed. I guess most children sleep in a twin... so it would be perfect for that reason. I do not like All the bright blue printing on the cover, would recommend a tag for those that need Warnings... and a much smaller logo. I covered it with a throw, as I do not like the bright blue in my taupe and red bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Relevant Rogue

customer_reviews.title: Works for our King bed
customer_reviews.text: So yes, the straps are just not quite long enough to reach the other side of the king bed. Why?!? Just make them longer! But ours has the double box frame so we just attached it in the middle, and it sticks up but we have a foam mattress and it seems fine. Wasn’t going to pay like 3 times more for a different model that suits a King. Good value for what it is. Haven’t tried lowering the side down yet.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Very strong!
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow is this railing strong! We transitioned our 2.5 year old daughter out of a crib and to a twin bed. I end up sleeping with her at some point of the night and able to really lean my adult weight against the railing to give her more room in bed. It was pretty easy to install, just followed the instructions. Make sure you check the straps on the button are tight or you will be falling off!
customer_reviews.author: ACP

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but good enough
customer_reviews.text: Yeah it doesn't fit our ikea bed but it'll still get the job done. I just hook it to the other side of the mattress and it holds strong enough for my son who likes to sleep against the rail. He's only managed to turn his body 90 degrees and somehow push his body head first out of bed once. Just make sure the opening by his head is smaller than the foot end.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: It attaches easily under the mattress and is secure
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my friend’s daughter. It works well, and with the mesh, my friend’s daughter can still see off the bed. She doesn't feel the need to climb on it to see over. It attaches easily under the mattress and is secure. She is using it on a twin bed and it covers a large enough area to keep him in the bed, despite him being all over the bed when he sleeps. She only used one bed rail on the twin bed and the other side is against the wall. I would buy again for my kid!
customer_reviews.author: yuan

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for something to get snug up against the bed, long enough to fit a toddler, and simple to use, this is it! Fits great on a queen. Using it to secure my son in his co-sleeper on my side of the bed. Very sturdy, will see how it holds up to a toddler, when it's used on his crib. Holds on by an adjustable strap that leads underneath the mattress, with a non damaging "hook" on the other side.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: I think it should be pointed out more this works better with a box spring / mattress combo
customer_reviews.text: Works well for it's intended purpose. I think it should be pointed out more this works better with a box spring / mattress combo. We use it with our sons converted crib. It requires a bit of manipulating to get this to work with this type of setup.
customer_reviews.author: Lafeesha

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: This guard works only for a bed frame or a flat platform bed. If your child's bed has vertical frame parts around the mattress this guard is not going to fit because of the bulky fold mechanism. I had to return it. The whole contraption feels flimsy, and one of the retaining straps was twisted.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: for the most part i really like. soft enough to not hurt. i like that you can flip it down without removing it. but making the bed and pulling the belts that hold it in place between the mattress and the box spring is a huge pain. HUGE. it made me not want to change the bed sheets. which i already don't like doing because it's next to the wall. barf. it was just kind of high maintenance. i miss the metal bars from yesteryear. boo.
customer_reviews.author: Stufflings

customer_reviews.title: Does take the whole length of a crib
customer_reviews.text: After figuring out how its suppose to be installed it went better installing it. So far so good. Weve only had it a couple of weeks. Our crib is where we put it and it does take the whole length up with very little room left to have them get out. We got it so he could get out himself and try and get him in his own big bed soon, but this isnt going to help. I guess we have one for the next bed.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Richardson

customer_reviews.title: DOES not fit on bottom bunk bed!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed...we needed a side rail as our daughter with special needs was falling out of bed. This was not only difficult to install - but practically impossible to change the sheets if it is on. She is on the lower bunk and there is just a mattress (no box spring) and it is angled and looks horrible, and doesn't work. Such a bummer as it's too late to return now.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Bummed. Cant use on the convertible crib
customer_reviews.text: It would be perfect if i could use if but unfortunately since my toddlers crib (that we transitioned to a toddler bed) isnt completely flat across the bottom, it wont fit. I am really bummed about it because i bought it before i was ready to use it and now my window to return is past. It seems it only works on beds that are completely level and flat on the bottom where it will be sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Great Bed Rail for animals and kids
customer_reviews.text: so, we had little problems putting together, actually our own fault, not looking closely at the instructions and pictures. Bed rail was installed at top of bed, I am using this bed rail for my small dog who sleeps next to my pillow and could fall over the edge.. One night with this rail and I know she cannot fall out of bed and she feels safer with it. Great little product for the money and it works... I actually dropped the rail down to make bed and put it back up without a problem.. 5 thumbs up for this bed rail...
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte A. Winkler

customer_reviews.title: I have positive and negative feelings about these bed rails
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for my granddaughter’s King sized bed. One of them are used on the side of her bed and it fit perfectly. However the second one that I used for the bottom of her bed did not fit to the top of her bed as it said it would. So I did my best to improvise with it and made it fit as best as I could. Overall I have to say that I am very happy with both of the rails that I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: This product was delivered in a beat up box. While it should have been easy to assemble the supports were backwards and I could only install the rail with the concave part away from the mattress which was incorrect. It also was not compatible with my child’s bed even though there was no indication that it may not be compatible with some toddler beds. The entire process was extremely frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle S Stehman

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, sometimes hard to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. The price is great and it’s been very durable with a toddler. It was much larger than I guess I envisioned, it was almost as long as our son’s crib. My only issue with it is that sometimes it won’t stay straight up and slightly tilts in towards the bed. My son doesn’t mind so it’s not a big deal but it drives me a little crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Not secure
customer_reviews.text: There’s not really much to like about this thing; it’s ugly, clunky, not secure, and doesn’t really function like is supposed to. It does the job, mostly. My two year old has not fallen out of her twin bed yet. But, a simple tug on this unit will pull it straight to the floor. It works for a 23 lb girl, but I wouldn’t trust it with a larger kiddo or an aging parent that is prone to falls.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy bed rail
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy bed rail. My 30lb 9 month old likes to bounce up against it in the mornings after waking up and it never has given way to him. Didn't realize it wasn't just a slided under matress type. It has handles attached to a thick ribbon that goes under the mattress and hooks on the complete opposite side. So a little difficult to install and take out by yourself, especially if the bed is against the wall. Next time I will buy a different style.
customer_reviews.author: flyboyfromtx

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for platform beds
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend for platform beds. The white plastic joints where the side rail and the arms (those silver bars that go under the mattress) is not flat and does not sit flush to the side of the platform bed, so the security of the entire unit is compromised. I recently learned that all the bed rails made by Summer Infant DO have the proper joints that work well with platform beds, so I will be purchasing one of those instead.
customer_reviews.author: Benson Childress

customer_reviews.title: We use this for cosleeping. Works very well, ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this for cosleeping. Works very well, just as intended. Also, my baby is obsessed with it. He loves feeling the textures, listening to the sound from scratching it, and staring at the blue logo and lettering. Who needs toys!
customer_reviews.author: C&D

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble/install & separate box spring and mattress required.
customer_reviews.text: I found this difficult to assemble. Instructions didn't help, just had to figure it out. Once I got it together I realized you need a separate box spring and mattress, which I don't have. And to install it you need to lift the mattress so it's a 2 man job. Doesn't work for my needs. And it's pretty huge, covers 2/3 of my daughters full size bed.
customer_reviews.author: KatieHernandez

customer_reviews.title: We've had this for a year it is still holding up great
customer_reviews.text: We've had this railing on my son's bed for over a year and it is still holding up great. We pushed his full sized bed into a corner in the room and put up the one railing on the open side of the bed. I don't think my son ever pushes against it in the night to wear it out, but it definitely keeps his stuffed animals on the bed so I'm glad I don't get woken up in the night when Puff Puff falls off. It is a little tedious to change the linens on the bed but that is to be expect. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.text: I have two 10 lb pups who burrow in their blankies. Sadly they burrow right off the edge of the bed lol. I have a queen bed and the straps went all the way across box springs with room to tighten. Quick shipping and easy to put together. Product seems of pretty good quality. Plenty of height to keep from rolling off. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hummerscott

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. We used it on my daughters twin size bed. She has been using it 6 months now with no problems. The only reason it was given 4 stars instead of 5, is because one of the parts was delivered broken. My husband was able to make it work, so we didn't have to go through the hassle and wait time of replacing the entire product.
customer_reviews.author: NicLJ

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is getting returned. For starters, the cover was impossible to put on. It took 2 adults about 15 minutes to get it zipped, and we couldn’t even get it all the way. The fabric isn’t ripping from how hard we had to pull it. For some reason there is a bar bowed outward that seems to be causing the issue. I don’t see anyone else mentioning it, so maybe we got a defect? There’s no other possible way to assemble the frame though. Second, we purchased for a toddler bed, which it does not work on.
customer_reviews.author: A. Vessels

customer_reviews.title: Too long for toddler bed
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install, worked really well but I returned it. I bought it for my son's toddler bed and it was too long. The space it left was too small for him to crawl in and out so he'd be trapped in his bed and trying to climb over it. Since that's a bit dangerous I sent it back. It would work great for a twin bed though.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R.

customer_reviews.title: No problems with assembly
customer_reviews.text: I just finished assembling with no problems. It took about 15-20 min (while arguing with my 4 year old who wanted to help). This did get some bad reviews but I took my chances and thankfully didn't have the problems that previous people had. Maybe the company has addressed the previous issues and fixed them at this point. The only thing that looks like it may be a little cumbersome is changing the mattress pad when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: karenman

customer_reviews.title: A bit too short for our mattresses
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure if we just purchase big mattresses but I think many people have 18” mattresses nowadays which only leaves about two inches of guard rail. We propped a pillow against the rail as an extra precaution and she has been ok so far. Wish they made the guard rails a bit higher maybe 24-30 inches if possible but for now it seems ok.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended. Not safe.
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2. One came damaged and the other broke after first night with what I'm guessing is the weight of a 25 lb 2 year old. We did Not even use the folding down option. I wish I read other reviews before buying two. This product should not be on the market. It would take very little for your child to fall out of bed.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great buy but make sure you measure
customer_reviews.text: This is super sturdy, easy to install, and the drop down feature to change sheets it great. The latch for the drop is safe and easy. This product is adjustable for many sizes beds. Make sure you measure before buying though It was a bit big for my sons crib so I had to offset it to the side a bit so he can get on and off, but he will be getting a big boy bed soon and I will be able to continue to use this.
customer_reviews.author: Marinaaa105

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars had this been on a box spring. Do not get if using on a bunk bed. I have a bunk bed without a box spring and used for the bottom bunk and it does not fit well leaves a large gap btw the bed side board and mattress because it shifts the mattress over. If your using on a box spring where a bed side board isn’t in the way then it’ll work much better.
customer_reviews.author: Leana

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE..
customer_reviews.text: I was in the same spot your in, looking for something to keep my child from rolling out of bed at a reasonable price. I read all the reviews that say it can be used without a box spring, which yes it can be after spending 3+ hours trying to figure out the best way how. Once I figured out how to secure it and make sure it wasn’t going anywhere it worked pretty good. Definitely a pain in the ass... but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh B.

customer_reviews.title: I know that it is from my dog but my dog love to sleep with my son at the 1st part ...
customer_reviews.text: So far it has done what it was bought for but I can already see the tears in the mesh, I know that it is from my dog but my dog love to sleep with my son at the 1st part of the night and then when its time to wake him up she runs in there to wake him up. I think that we need to start brain storming on a stronger material for the mesh area, I have gone through 2 this is my 3rd (and this is the 1st for this puppy to see the bed rail, we teach her but a 7 month old lab and a 4 yr old boy I'm sure you can understand)
customer_reviews.author: JelloCF

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT PURCHASE!!! So easy to install, even for me (a woman), with no tools what so ever, I can take advantage of my King size bed now. I have 3 kids and the 2 little ones usually climb on my bed during the night, this gives us extra safety because it is not safe for the kids to sleep next to each other (the baby is 6 months old and the big one is 2 years old), so, the baby sleeps between my husband and I and my toddler sleeps between me and the bedrail, PERFECT solution, it stays firm even when my son leans against it completely. Very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: SaskiaH

customer_reviews.title: WTH????
customer_reviews.text: Bought this guard rail a yr ago for our shore house for when my grandkids come to visit. We used it 3 TIMES and it worked fine. Went to put it in this morning since my toddler grandson will be here soon and the rail flapped - wouldn't lock. Noticed on 1 web strip that the plastic hook lock was missing so we figured we'd try to just lock the other 1 in place and that's when we noticed it just FLAPPED. Doesn't lock. Called customer service and they said there was nothing they could do - only a 90 day warranty. Soooooo disappointed with their "solution". When we purchase a replacement, we will NOT be purchasing THIS guard rail.
customer_reviews.author: laura curran

customer_reviews.title: Plastic piece broke after 1 use
customer_reviews.text: The plastic grommets broke (the piece that goes inside the lock for the fold down) after 1 use. The fence still seems to stay upright fine, but if the grommets aren't there anymore I question if it will be able to fold down or even hold in place effectively. I'll cross my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Dahonorable JB

customer_reviews.title: Good for safety, but can’t wash properly
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t wash well. You can’t put it in the washing machine or it will start ripping and shredding at the seems, but hand washing wasn’t enough when our daughter threw up everywhere in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: Dltmom

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well on a king bed.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to keep my elderly dog with poor eye site from wandering off the side of the bed. The straps weren't long enough to secure it under the mattress of my king bed. I believe the seller states this In the specs of the product. It stays secure under the mattress for my use, but may not stay in place with true body weight against it.
customer_reviews.author: Kaycee

customer_reviews.title: Unsteady and difficult to install
customer_reviews.text: This rail was super difficult to install. Instead of hard rails that extend all the way under the mattress, it has adjustable straps that "hook" onto the other end of the bed frame. I get that it's so it can be used with multiple sizes of mattresses, but the hooks seem extremely unstable and mvoe side to side with any movement of the mattress, causing the bed rail to become loose and hazardous. And you definitely need two people to adjust and install the whole thing and even then it's difficult. I would have paid more for a product with longer rails that extend all the way under the mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa O.

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh....
customer_reviews.text: This product works, however install is not as easy as it is portrayed. My husband had quite a time getting it attached to the bed. I’m also not really enthused with how wobbly it is along with the gap where my baby’s toys and limbs get caught in (unless this is just simply due to the difficult installation). I wish I would’ve went with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kalei Johns

customer_reviews.title: ripped easily.
customer_reviews.text: It ripped fast. The only thing I like was how easy it is to assemble and use. Other than that I don't have anything to say about it. I wish the material was better. But you get what you pay for i guess
customer_reviews.author: Devin daddy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Easy assembly! Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: It is longer than I expected, but it is exactly the size it says it is. It covers about 75% of my sons twin bed. We don’t have a box spring, so I just put a very thin piece of plywood under his mattress so this wouldn’t fall through the bars of his bed. I sleep a lot better knowing he isn’t going to fall from his bed.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Safe. Great for children.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product. I bought this for my baby who sleeps next to me for part of the night. The product is long so I know he can’t fall out of the bed. It’s secure and safe. My sister set it up for me and she seemed to have an easy go at it. It swings down so if you don’t want to use it, it won’t get in the way of you getting in and out of the bed. I use one for my 5 year old as well and it is fantastic. I often see her asleep leaning on it - if it wasn’t there she’d have fallen on the floor. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Vwall

customer_reviews.title: Great bed rail
customer_reviews.text: I put this together and placed on our bed all by myself, although it would’ve been much easier with a second person. I don’t recommend using it on a bed without a box spring (we have a “bed in a box” mattress and it works, but would definitely be a lot easier to use with a box spring). Very sturdy and the straps stay put without loosening over time. The cover can be taken off and washed in the washer as well. I definitely recommend this bed rail.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brendle

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this long time ago
customer_reviews.text: My 3 yr kept rolling off bed at night so I finally bought this. Other than one part that's particular hard to assemble, the rest of the process was relatively easy, and it seems pretty sturdy despite kids kicking and leaning on it.
customer_reviews.author: Shimin Guo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother and this isn’t for the toddler bed.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike it, although I purchased it by a mistake. I thought it was for the toddler bed but apparently I wasn’t paying attention and clicked the wrong size but I got an idea of it if I were to get a small one. It looked like the hospital theme which I didn’t like. Assembling was difficult. Forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall's wife

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This thing was extremely easy to install and works great. I love that it can drop down the side to make it easier to change the bedding and make the bed. Seems really sturdy and I haven't had any issues with it. Would definitely recommend for those wanting to keep their little ones safe from falling out of bed at night.
customer_reviews.author: K Y H

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to install, should use w/box spring.
customer_reviews.text: This is super easy to install, and holds up even with a two year old climbing over it. The way that it attaches is not designed to work with beds that hold the mattress within a frame. Needs a box spring to attach properly. We have one that frames in the mattress and we made it work, but it sits kind of weird on the non-rail side.
customer_reviews.author: Wes W.

customer_reviews.title: Worked with platform bed
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for our platform twin bed. The item itself states this is not intended for a platform (w/slats ) but we were able to make it work just fine. Could not secure the straps and there is a small gap on the outer side of gate between bed rail but it feels very secure, held in place by the mattress itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I actually got this to help with an older large dog that started rolling out of bed in the middle of the night. It works perfect for her- she can roll right into it and not fall between it and the bed. Sturdy enough to even stand up to her paws smacking at the covering on the bars. I’ve found my mattress moving a bit more on the box springs with it attached but not enough to dock any stars. Well worth her safety and my peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Anatamation

customer_reviews.title: It’s short
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, but is very short. My baby grabs on to it and pulls herself up, could easily flip right over it. I was hoping it was higher.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Prinzi

customer_reviews.title: Not high enough for thicker mattress
customer_reviews.text: This product was fairly easy to assemble but it can't possibly be 20" high as described! Our mattress is 14" tall and it only came up maybe an inch past the top of our mattress -- completely useless. Beware if you have a thicker mattress!
customer_reviews.author: woolgathering

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: We couldn’t figure out what went wrong. We went over directions several times and we ended up figuring out a solution. We ended up knotting the straps together which worked. I wish directions had pictures to see how it should look when installed along the way and finished.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen P

customer_reviews.title: Terrible assemble
customer_reviews.text: This was literally this most frustrating thing to put together as one person. My husband works all day and I wanted to put this together for my son. It took me over an hour to figure out how to put together and how to assemble to my bed. I wanted to throw it out the window. Not to mention the baby crying the entire time didnt help my patience levels.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Peña

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper but not necessarily better
customer_reviews.text: Four stars bc you have to clip it into place rather than it snapping into place. Sheets and blankets get in the way and it has to lean in a little more, so if you put it up after child has fallen asleep (like we do reading books each night), I’d spend the little extra $$ on the safety first one also because it doesn’t fit the bed as well. It is longer though, so that might be better for some people.
customer_reviews.author: Philip J Zaubi

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This item works as advertised, took a little bit of interpretation to understand the instructions but it works as advertised. The swing down function is kind of useless on my daughter's standard twin bed but could be useful on a taller bed, all in all I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for big kid bed transitions
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for both of my kids and I highly recommend them for keeping newly upgraded toddlers in their big kid beds. Both of my children sleep like tornadoes and the extra long length of this rail gives me peace of mind knowing my two year old won't fling himself off in the middle of the night. Definitely recommend these as a temporary fix versus a toddler bed or conversion crib.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy.
customer_reviews.text: Product was simple to assemble and was easy to install on my own. I will say though if you want to use on a bed with slats instead of boxspring and if you have a bedrame that comes above the bottom of the matress this isn't the product for you. We won't be able to use the swivel because of the bedframe of our sons bed. It wasn't a deal breaker in the end, but it was a feature we were looking forward to using and won't be able to.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Lee

customer_reviews.title: perfect for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this because my dog kept falling off the bed at night. (She a 22 lb Cavalier King Charles.) I just set a few pillows up against it and she's happy as a clam. I was much relieved by the price tag on this item. I did not want to spend a lot of money and blessedly I didn't have to.
customer_reviews.author: PomsMom

product_meta.title: Regalo Swing Down Bed Rail Guard, with Reinforced Anchor Safety System
product_meta.description:
RECOMMENDED FOR USE ON A TWIN TO QUEEN SIZE MATTRESS


MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
customer support at 952-435-1080, service@regalo-baby.com or at www.regalo-baby.com
feature_bullets: SWING DOWN: The patented swing down feature allows this bedrail to pivot down and out of the way when getting in and out of bed or removing sheets
SAFE: 43-inches long and 20-inch tall for added security. Certified by American Testing Society and Juvenile Product Manufactures Association
FIT: For use with a twin to queen size bed. For use with a box spring only. To ensure proper fit please follow fit guidelines
EASY TO SET UP: No tools required. Rail cover is machine washable. The durable nylon mesh fabric that encloses the steel frame, is soft to the touch and comfortable for your little one
SECURE: Anchoring strap that secures the bedrail to the bed. Designed with all steel frame

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars6,238 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
